content: Of all the U.S. Presidents, which one served the shortest term, dying just 32 days after his inauguration?

That would be William Henry Harrison, the ninth President of the United States. He took office on March 4, 1841, and died on April 4, 1841, from pneumonia, which he contracted after delivering a lengthy inaugural address in cold and wet weather without wearing a coat or hat. His term was the shortest in U.S. presidential history, lasting only 31 days.
